org.ensor.math.analysis

Class LinearFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ensor.math.analysis.LinearFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDifferentiable, IDifferentiableFunction<LinearFunction>, IFunction, IVector<LinearFunction>

    public class LinearFunction
extends Object
implements IDifferentiableFunction<LinearFunction>
    This class implements a linear function.
    Author:
    jona

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinearFunction(ConstantFunction aConstant) 
      LinearFunction(double aStart, double aDelta)
      The constructor creates a linear interpolator which runs from the start to the end point.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LinearFunction add(LinearFunction aValue)
      This function returns a new linear function which is the sum of this function and the given function.
      ConstantFunction getDerivative()
      This method returns the first derivative of the linear function.
      double getRoot()
      This method returns the value of 't' for which the linear expression evaluates to zero.
      double getValue(double t)
      This method returns the point value for the specified path parameter.
      LinearFunction multiply(double aValue)
      This function returns a new linear function which is the result of multiplying this function by the given number.
      LinearFunction negate()
      This function returns a new function which is the negation of this one.
      LinearFunction subtract(LinearFunction aValue)
      This function returns a new linear function which is the result of subtracting the given function from this function.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinearFunction

        public LinearFunction(double aStart,
              double aDelta)
        The constructor creates a linear interpolator which runs from the start to the end point.
        Parameters:
        aStart - Start point of the interpolation for t=0.
        aDelta - Slope of the line.

      • LinearFunction

        public LinearFunction(ConstantFunction aConstant)

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public double getValue(double t)
        This method returns the point value for the specified path parameter. The path parameter runs from 0 to 1.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface IFunction
        Parameters:
        t - Path parameter.
        Returns:
        The point between start and end of path corresponding to this path location.

      • getDerivative

        public ConstantFunction getDerivative()
        This method returns the first derivative of the linear function. This is always a constant function which represents the slope of the line.
        Specified by:
        getDerivative in interface IDifferentiable
        Returns:
        The (constant) differentiable function which is the slope of this linear function.

      • getRoot

        public double getRoot()
        This method returns the value of 't' for which the linear expression evaluates to zero.
        Returns:
        The value of the parameter such that the expression evaluates to to zero.

      • add

        public LinearFunction add(LinearFunction aValue)
        This function returns a new linear function which is the sum of this function and the given function.
        Specified by:
        add in interface IVector<LinearFunction>
        Parameters:
        aValue - A linear function to add.
        Returns:
        The sum of adding this linear function to the given function.

      • subtract

        public LinearFunction subtract(LinearFunction aValue)
        This function returns a new linear function which is the result of subtracting the given function from this function.
        Specified by:
        subtract in interface IVector<LinearFunction>
        Parameters:
        aValue - A linear function to subtract.
        Returns:
        The result of subtracting the given function from this one.

      • multiply

        public LinearFunction multiply(double aValue)
        This function returns a new linear function which is the result of multiplying this function by the given number.
        Specified by:

        This function returns a new function which is the negation of this one.
